docs.title: Welcome to use the CliMet Server Service (CSS)
docs.text: This website provides documents related to the CliMet Server.

docs.title: Document layout
docs.text:
-Home
-Server
    -Introduction # Description of Server Information
    -Softwares    # Softwares Installation and Configuration
    -Datasets     # Datasets on Server
-Dataset
-About

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Softwares on Climet Server
docs.text: Software Discription Version VNC Virtual Network Computing TigerVNC 1.13.0 Matlab HKUST acadamic license Matlab 2023a Miniconda Python Env. Manager V23.5.0

docs.title: Configuration at Server Point
docs.text:
1. Log in the server using ssh command on your local computer: 

    ssh [username]@[xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx server ip address]

  2. Set the password for the vnc connection on your local computer: 

    vncpasswd

  3. Start the vnc server: 

    vncserver -localhost no

  4. Check the vnc server status and the port # (DISPLAY #): 

    vncserver -list

Note

Please keep in mind for the number in the X DISPLAY column. This will be used when you try to connect to the vncviewer clients.

docs.title: Configuration at Client Point
docs.text:
You can use the vnc viewer client to connect the vnc server created as above. vnc viewer clients

  • TigerVNC viewer
  • RealVNC viewer

docs.title: Stop the vnc Server
docs.text: If you want to stop vnc server, you just kill the server via terminal command on your local computer. vncserver -kill:* '*' is for all vnc servers; you can use number to kill a specific port.
